text.p: The following are some of the leading stories in the July 26 edition of Russia's newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Patriarch Alexiy, head of the Russian Orthodox Church, criticised President Boris Yeltsin for the first time in public for vetoing a controversial law on religion. The bill stirred fears among human right groups and religious minorities that Russia was returning to the Soviet-style control over worship.

- Russia's economy is recovering and structural reforms of natural monopolies are under way, said Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin on Friday, reporting on the government's economic achievements for the last six months.
- Over one million Russians were in prison on July 1, according to an Interior Ministry report.
- President Boris Yeltsin said in his radio address on Friday that the vetoed law on religion violated human rights.
- The government is planning to find new sources of budget revenues, the head of the State Tax Service Alexander Pochinok is quoted as saying.
